item.title: Alphabet Chess
item.description: Chess has been played in different forms since the seventh century, and in its modern form since the nineteenth century. Opening theory, i.e. the study of the best moves to begin the game with, has been developing since then. The EGG Opening I was inspired the other day after watching a video by Eric Rosen called “Quadruple Egg”. Chess boards are usually notated from left to right with the letters A through H.

item.title: What is the Hardest Hangman Word?
item.description: It seems like a simple enough question. Which word should you choose so that it takes your opponent the most guesses to discover it? Should you choose a long word to use up your opponent’s guesses? Or perhaps a short word with obscure letters? In this document I look into this question. But first, a bit of background. If you’re not familiar with the rules of hangman, it is a guessing game played between two people.
